div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1014 Nymphaeum (mod. Geroevka, for- merly Ėl'tigen), S of Kerch', Crimea oblast, Ukraine, 1870 Burial: mid 4th cent. B.C. (Shelov) Contents: c. 100 AR. Pot hoard Nymphaeum: fr. (as Minns, pl. 9, 8-9) Panticapaeum: fr. (as Minns, pl. 5, 1-2, 4-6, 10; pl. 9, 10; Burachkov, pl. 19, 4) Disposition: dispersed † Liutsenko, pp. 16-7 Zograph, pp. 163,166
